isis.stitle: TSI 01-03-02 - Determining Service Life of Cracked Composite Steer Axle Springs on International 9000 4x2, 6x2, and 6x4 Models for D.O.T. or for Diamond Spec Warranty Coverage

subjectgroup.subject: Determining Service Life of Cracked Composite Steer Axle Springs on International 9000 4x2, 6x2, and 6x4 Models for D.O.T. or for Diamond Spec Warranty Coverage

geninfo.para: This document outlines and illustrates some spring cracks which may be found on composite front springs available on International Models with a build date of 1997 or later. Illustrated is the replacement criteria, the type and/or amount of cracking, which result in replacement status for this spring.

step1.para: A crack that extends beyond 3/4 the length of the spring ( Figure 1 and Figure 2).
Intersecting cracks of any length; i.e., two cracks that cross each other ( Figure 3).

note.para: A crack is a separation in any axis which passes completely through the spring.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Side to side crack extending beyond 3/4 the length of the spring
Figure 2. Top to bottom crack that extends beyond 3/4 the length of the spring
Figure 3. Intersecting cracks of any length
